meanings.definition: A person or entity that seizes or confiscates property as a penalty for non-payment or violation.
meanings.sent1: The impounder took away the car for not paying the parking tickets.
meanings.sent2: The impounder is responsible for holding onto items until the fines are paid.
meanings.sent3: The impounder must have a lot of keys to all the impounded vehicles!
meanings.sent4: The impounder's job is like being a temporary guardian of the confiscated belongings.
meanings.sent5: The impounder's role is to keep the seized items safe and secure.

meanings.definition: To seize or confiscate property as a penalty for non-payment or violation.
meanings.sent1: The city can impounder vehicles parked illegally on the streets.
meanings.sent2: If you don't pay your fines, they will impounder your possessions.
meanings.sent3: I hope they don't impounder my bike for leaving it in the wrong spot!
meanings.sent4: The authorities will impounder any goods that are not claimed within a certain period.
meanings.sent5: The government has the power to impounder assets in case of serious offenses.
